channel.title: Level 200: Automated IAM User Cleanup on AWS Well-Architected Labs
channel.description: Recent content in Level 200: Automated IAM User Cleanup on AWS Well-Architected Labs

item.title: Deploying IAM Lambda Cleanup with AWS SAM
item.description: Download these two templates (or by cloning this repository): cloudformation-iam-user-cleanup.yaml lambda-iam-user-cleanup.py Create an Amazon S3 bucket if you don’t already have one, it needs to be in the same AWS region being deployed into. Now that you have the S3 bucket created and the files downloaded to your machine. You can start to create your deployment package on the command line with AWS SAM. Make sure you are working in the folder where where you have downloaded the files to.

item.title: Tear down
item.description: It is recommended to keep this lab in place to continuously audit your environment. To remove this stack execute: aws cloudformation delete-stack --stack-name IAM-User-Cleanup
